p: Further spatiotemporal migration analysis showed that the A/H1N1pdm virus spread from East China to South China and North China in about 2010, from where the virus further spread to other geographical regions in 2011 ( Supplementary File S2: video). During 2012â€“2016, there were rare migration events to occur possibly due to low activity of the virus. Since 2017, East China, South China, and North China formed three new epicenters of the A/H1N1pdm pandemic, and spread the virus to other geographical regions.
